SENT.plain: We report sensory changes after tongue reduction by the Harada-Enomoto method for macroglossia in a 20-year-old woman with Beckwith-Wiedemann syndrome
Sensory tests were performed before surgery and 1 week and 2 months after surgery
We assessed the static tactile threshold, vibration sense, static 2-point discrimination, pain threshold, and taste
No sensory loss of any category tested was observed after tongue reduction
